author: Deleted User
content: Thanks Joseph. Actually, the idea of 3 networks was quite rough (it still is) at the Summit. Now it is a bit more defined. The main conclusion so far for me is that we should not be building a special DHT-based network just to support Beam Sync (because as I said it in the past, it is not on the critical path, and is mostly a distraction), but rather make Beam Sync work on top of Light Client Protocol instead of GetNodeData

author: pipermerriam
content: Small clarification, The dht network was to support eth_call/eth_estimategas. Beam sync is largely  orthogonal.

author: pipermerriam
content: Deprioritizaton of the dht network was accepting that stateless client support is still useful/valuable without eth_call/eth_estimategas support
